Section 8.39 Wireless Telecommunications Towers
A.
Wireless communications facilities attached to existing or proposed structures such as water towers,
transmission towers, church steeples, streetlights, bell towers, or similar structures do not require a
Special Use Permit.
B. The maximum height shall be 150 feet.
C. Evidence the tower will be utilized by a wireless provider.
D. Towers shall be setback a distance equal to the total height measured from grade elevation from all
adjoining properties. Where the transmission tower is located adjacent to a R-P, R-S or R-T zoning lot
or street and there is no intervening structure to block the view of the tower base and improvements, a
Type A buffer yard shall be installed around the outside of all improvements on the site, including the
base of the tower, any ground buildings or equipment, and security fencing, SO as to provide spatial
separation and create a visual block from adjacent properties and streets.

E.
All new towers shall be set back a minimum of one hundred (100) feet from any adjacent zoning lot
zoned R-P, R-S, and R-T; and a minimum forty (40) feet from any other adjacent zoning lot.
Additionally, all new towers shall be setback a minimum distance equal to tower height from any
existing residential structure and from any public street.
F. The tower shall be structurally designed to support at least one additional user, and the special use
application shall include a statement that the owner is willing to permit other user(s) to attach
communication facilities, on a commercially reasonable basis, which do not interfere with the primary
purpose of the tower.
G. Access to available technically feasible space for collocation on any towers shall not be denied to any
competitive users or service provider.
H. Applicants shall provide a N.C. licensed engineering certification that states the structure's construction
in the event of collapse will cause no damage to structures on adjacent zoning lots.
I.
When towers are proposed within the RS zoning district, existing trees within the distance of the tower
height shall be preserved for the life of the tower, except for trees that need to be removed to construct
access and for the tower compound. Documentation shall be included with the application that
demonstrates control of the land necessary for the tower compound and tree preservation area through
property ownership, long-term lease, or easement.
J.
Unless otherwise required by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), the finish of the transmission
tower shall be non-shiny or glossy; any painted color shall be muted or neutral; and no lights or strobe
lights shall be placed on the tower. If lights are required by the FAA, the least obtrusive lighting option
available under FAA guidelines shall be installed; white strobe lights are discouraged from use.
K. No outside storage shall be allowed on any facility site.
L.
Associated buildings located in any residential zoning district shall not be used as an employment
center for any worker. This provision does not prohibit the periodic maintenance or monitoring of
equipment and instruments.
M. No commercial advertising shall be allowed on the facility's site.
N. Security fencing of at least 6 feet in height shall be provided around the tower base and any ground
equipment.
O. All wireless communications towers shall be constructed using a monopole design.
P. Towers shall meet the standards of the Federal Aviation Administration and the Federal
Communications Commission.
